==Events==
*  [[14]] &ndash; [[Agrippa Postumus]], adopted son of the late [[Roman emperor|Roman Emperor]] [[Augustus]], is executed by his guards while in exile under mysterious circumstances.
* [[636]] &ndash; [[Battle of Yarmouk]]: [[Arab people|Arab]] forces led by [[Khalid ibn al-Walid]] take control of [[Syria]] and [[Palestine]] away from the [[Byzantine Empire]], marking the first great wave of [[Muslim]] conquests and the rapid advance of [[Islam]] outside [[Arabian Peninsula|Arabia]].
* [[917]] &ndash; [[Battle of Achelous (917)|Battle of Acheloos]]: Tsar [[Simeon I of Bulgaria]] decisively defeats a [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] army.
*[[1000]] &ndash; The foundation of the [[Hungary|Hungarian]] state by [[Stephen I of Hungary|Saint Stephen]], celebrated as a National Day in [[Hungary]].
*[[1083]] &ndash; Canonization of the first [[King of Hungary]], Saint Stephen and his son [[Saint Emeric of Hungary|Saint Emeric]].
*[[1308]] &ndash; [[Pope Clement V]] pardons [[Jacques de Molay]], the last [[Grand Masters of the Knights Templar|Grand Master of the Knights Templar]], absolving him of charges of [[heresy]].
*[[1391]] &ndash; [[Konrad von Wallenrode]] becomes the 24th [[Grand Masters of the Teutonic Knights|Hochmeister]] of the [[Teutonic Knights|Teutonic Order]].
*[[1467]] &ndash; The [[Second Battle of Olmedo]] takes places as part of a succession conflict between [[Henry IV of Castile]] and his half-brother [[Alfonso, Prince of Asturias (1453–1468)|Alfonso, Prince of Asturias]].
*[[1519]] &ndash; Philosopher and general [[Wang Yangming]] defeats [[Zhu Chenhao]], ending the [[Prince of Ning rebellion]] against the reign of the [[Ming Dynasty]] emperor [[Zhengde Emperor|Zhengde]].
*[[1672]] &ndash; Former [[Grand Pensionary]] [[Johan de Witt]] and his brother [[Cornelis de Witt|Cornelis]] are brutally murdered by an angry mob in [[The Hague]].
*[[1707]] &ndash; The first [[Siege of Pensacola (1707)|Siege of Pensacola]] comes to end with the failure of the British to capture [[Pensacola, Florida]].
*[[1710]] &ndash; [[War of the Spanish Succession]]: a multinational army led by the Austrian commander [[Guido Starhemberg]] defeats the Spanish-Bourbon army commanded by [[Alexandre Maître, Marquis de Bay]] in the [[Battle of Saragossa]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; The [[Spain|Spanish]] establish the [[Presidio San Augustin del Tucson]] in the town that became [[Tucson, Arizona]].
*[[1794]] &ndash; [[Battle of Fallen Timbers]] – [[United States|American]] troops force a confederacy of [[Shawnee]], [[Mingo]], [[Lenape|Delaware]], [[Wyandot people|Wyandot]], [[Miami people|Miami]], [[Odawa people|Ottawa]], [[Ojibwe people|Chippewa]], and [[Potawatomi]] warriors into a disorganized retreat.
*[[1858]] &ndash; [[Charles Darwin]] first publishes his theory of [[evolution]] through [[natural selection]] in ''The Journal of the Proceedings of the Linnean Society of London'', alongside [[Alfred Russel Wallace]]'s same theory.
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Andrew Johnson]] formally declares the [[American Civil War]] over.
*[[1882]] &ndash; [[Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky|Tchaikovsky]]'s ''[[1812 Overture]]'' debuts in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; The [[Great Fire of 1910]] (also commonly referred to as the "Big Blowup" or the "Big Burn") occurs in northeast [[Washington (state)|Washington]], northern Idaho (the panhandle), and western Montana, burning approximately {{convert|3|e6acre|km2}}.
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Germany|German]] forces occupy [[Brussels]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; The first commercial [[radio]] station, 8MK (now [[WWJ (AM)|WWJ]]), begins operations in [[Detroit|Detroit, Michigan]].
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[Japan]]'s [[public broadcasting]] company, [[NHK|Nippon Hōsō Kyōkai]] (NHK) is established.
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Lou Gehrig]] hits his 23rd career grand slam – a record that stood for 75 years until it was broken by [[Alex Rodriguez]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; In [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]] exiled Russian revolutionary [[Leon Trotsky]] is fatally wounded with an ice axe by [[Ramón Mercader]]. He dies the next day.
*  1940   &ndash; [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|British Prime Minister]] [[Winston Churchill]] makes the fourth of his famous wartime speeches, containing the line "[[Never was so much owed by so many to so few]]".
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[KLB Club|168 captured allied airmen]], including [[Phil Lamason]], accused by the [[Gestapo]] of being "terror fliers", arrive at [[Buchenwald concentration camp]].
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: the [[Battle of Romania]] begins with a major [[Soviet Union]] offensive.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: [[United Nations]] [[Battle of Taegu|repel]] an offensive by [[North Korea]]n divisions attempting to cross the [[Nakdonggang|Naktong River]] and assault the city of [[Daegu|Taegu]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; In [[Morocco]], a force of [[Berber people|Berbers]] from the [[Atlas Mountains]] region of [[Algeria]] raid two rural settlements and kill 77 [[France|French]] nationals.
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Senegal]] breaks from the [[Mali Federation]], declaring its independence.
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[NS Savannah|NS ''Savannah'']], the world's first [[Nuclear marine propulsion|nuclear-powered]] civilian ship, embarks on its [[maiden voyage]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; Soviet Union-dominated [[Warsaw Pact]] troops invade [[Czechoslovakia]], crushing the [[Prague Spring]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Viking program|Viking Program]]: [[NASA]] launches the ''[[Viking 1]]'' planetary probe toward [[Mars]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Voyager program|Voyager Program]]: NASA launches the ''[[Voyager 2]]'' spacecraft.
*[[1986]] &ndash; In [[Edmond, Oklahoma]], [[United States Postal Service|U.S. Postal]] employee [[Patrick Sherrill]] guns down 14 of his co-workers and then commits [[suicide]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; "Black Saturday" of the [[Yellowstone fires of 1988|Yellowstone fire]] in [[Yellowstone National Park]]
*  1988   &ndash; [[Peru]] becomes a member of the [[Berne Convention for the Protection of Literary and Artistic Works|Berne Convention]] copyright treaty.
*  1988   &ndash; [[Iran–Iraq War]]: a [[ceasefire]] is agreed after almost eight years of war.
*  1988   &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: Eight [[British Army]] soldiers are killed and 28 wounded when their bus is hit by a [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] roadside bomb in [[Northern Ireland]], [[United Kingdom]] (see [[Ballygawley bus bombing]]).
*[[1989]] &ndash; The pleasure boat [[Marchioness disaster|''Marchioness'' sinks]] on the [[River Thames]] following a collision. 51 people are killed.
*  1989   &ndash; The [[O-Bahn Busway]] in [[Adelaide]], the world's longest [[guided bus]]way, opens.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Dissolution of the Soviet Union]], [[1991 Soviet coup d'état attempt|August Coup]]: more than 100,000 people rally outside the Soviet Union's parliament building protesting the [[Coup d'état|coup]] aiming to depose [[President of the Soviet Union|President]] [[Mikhail Gorbachev]].
*  1991   &ndash; [[Estonia]], annexed by the  Soviet Union in 1940, issues a decision on the re-establishment of independence on the basis of historical continuity of its pre-World War II statehood.
*[[1993]] &ndash; After rounds of secret negotiations in [[Norway]], the [[Oslo Accords]] are signed, followed by a public ceremony in [[Washington, D.C.]] the following month.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Souhane massacre]] in [[Algeria]]; over 60 people are killed and 15 kidnapped.
*[[1998]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of Canada]] [[Reference re Secession of Quebec|rules]] that [[Quebec]] cannot legally secede from [[Canada]] without the federal government's approval.
*  1998   &ndash; [[1998 United States embassy bombings|U.S. embassy bombings]]: the [[United States]] launches [[Cruise missile strikes on Afghanistan and Sudan (August 1998)|cruise missile attacks]] against alleged [[al-Qaeda]] camps in [[Afghanistan]] and a suspected chemical plant in [[Sudan]] in retaliation for the [[August 7]] bombings of American embassies in [[Kenya]] and [[Tanzania]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; A group of [[Iraq]]is opposed to the regime of [[Saddam Hussein]] take over the Iraqi [[Diplomatic mission|Embassy]] in [[Berlin]], Germany for five hours before releasing their hostages and surrendering.
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[Spanair Flight 5022]], from [[Madrid]], Spain to [[Gran Canaria]], skids off the runway and crashes at [[Madrid-Barajas Airport|Barajas Airport]]. 146 people are killed in the crash, and 8 more die later. Only 18 people survive.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[2012 Caracas prison riot|prison riot]] in the [[Venezuela]]n capital, [[Caracas]], kills at least 20 people.
